stocks.news:
Golden Quarter:

McDonald's (MCD +2.74%) investors are McLovin' their idecisions with the fast food chain seeing sales jump nearly 7% year-over-year.

‚Ä¢ This is one year after an E. coli outbreak quarter-pounded sales into a low.

Why the jump? Some analysts are saying it's due to the company's $5 Meal Deal strategy‚Ä¶our analysts are saying it's the new McGLP-1 strategy (more below).

Cisco (CSCO -12.32%) plummeted more than 12% despite beating revenue and earnings projections.

What happened? Rising memory costs.

High demand for computer memory caused the price to skyrocket, cutting into profits.

Briefs Finance analysts believe this may create a rare entry point for Cisco, whose AI assets may be undervalued - they'll be diving deeper in Saturday's report.

economy.commentary:
President Trump signed an Executive Order directing the Department of War to purchase reliable coal power for military installations to prevent blackouts and strengthen national security.

www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2026/02/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-strengthens-united-states-national-defense-with-americas-beautiful-clean-coal-power-generation-fleet/

Moscow has a message for Meta (META -2.82%) - and let's just say WhatsApp won't be delivering it.

The Kremlin says Russians need to log off WhatsApp completely, and is pushing its state-supported app, MAX.
‚Ä¢ Why? Russia says Meta would not release user data, and critics say Russia could use MAX to get it.

crypto.note: *Numbers as of 4:40 pm ET on Feb 12th
crypto.commentary:
Bank BTC Target Lower:

British bank Standard Chartered has cut its Bitcoin price target, again.

In December, the bank cut its target to $100K by the end of 2025.

Now, the same analyst says BTC could hit $50K.

real_estate.homebuilder:
Another Housing Coldfront:

Sales of already owned homes fell 8% in January - the biggest single-month drop since February 2022.

Why the drop? Buyers are bailing. Mixed confidence about the economy, fewer homes on the market, means some Americans put their home dreams on hold.
‚Ä¢ Homes are sitting on the market for longer - 46 days, up from 41 in Jan 2025.

Unless you're buying a $1 million+ home, as that was the only segment that saw a rise in prices last month.

The Commercial Crater:

The Super Bowl is all about commercials - but in real estate, not so much‚Ä¶

real_estate.commentary:
üè° Alameda County vs. Santa Clara County:

Both counties are seeing a slow but steady seasonal increase in inventory, which is good news if you are spending your weekend going to open houses.

‚Ä¢ Alameda County: This is where buyers are currently finding slightly more breathing room. The median sale price is sitting around $950,000, which is actually down a bit (about 7%) year-over-year. Homes are spending an average of 28 to 32 days on the market. Buyers who are willing to commute a little further are finding better value here.

‚Ä¢ Santa Clara County: The South Bay remains a premium market. The median sale price is holding steady at $1.5M, experiencing a very minor 1% dip compared to last year. Homes here sell faster than in Alameda County, averaging just 24 days on the market. The high-end luxury market and single-family homes in prime school districts remain intensely competitive.

‚Ä¢ Inventory is Waking Up: If you are heading out this weekend, you should notht uptick in "For Sale" signs. Sellers who held off during the winter holidays are starting to list, meaning buyers finally have a few more choices, easing the bidding war pressure just a fraction.

Bay Area real estate can be an emotional rollercoaster, so having a firm grasp on the data is your best defense.

No-Fee ADU Permits in Milpitas: For Milpitas homeowners, the city just announced that it is currently waiving permit fees for building or legalizing Accessory Dwelling Units (ADUs). The Office of Building Safety will cover these fees via the Community Investment Fund, which could save eligible homeowners an average of $5,000.

Major Drug Bust: Authorities announced the discovery of 300 pounds of processed marijuana in an illegal cultivation investigation in San Leandro, which resulted in a Wednesday arrest.
